item.title: Polish parliament passes controversial media bill
item.description: Opponents say the plans are an attempt to silence a TV channel critical of the government.

item.title: Tourist helicopter crashes into Russian lake
item.description: Eight people survived after a helicopter with 16 people crashed in the Far East region, reports say.

item.title: Italy may have registered Europe's hottest temperature on record
item.description: If the registered reading is verified, it will be hottest temperature ever recorded in Europe.

item.title: Briton suspected of spying for Russia arrested in Germany
item.description: German federal prosecutors say the British man passed documents to Russian intelligence for cash.

item.title: The shopkeeper saving his island from wildfires
item.description: Spyros isn't a firefighter, but when his home was threatened with wildfires, he decided to take action.

item.title: Instagram says sorry for removing Pedro Almodovar film poster
item.description: The advert for revered Spanish director Pedro Almodovar's new film features a lactating nipple.

item.title: Uefa Super Cup: Chelsea defeat Villarreal on penalties in Belfast to lift trophy for second time
item.description: Chelsea beat Villarreal 6-5 in a penalty shootout to lift the Uefa Super Cup for a second time after a draining 120 minutes of action ends 1-1 in Belfast.

item.title: Wagner: Scale of Russian mercenary mission in Libya exposed
item.description: A Samsung tablet obtained by the BBC unveils chilling details of how mercenaries fought in Libyaâ€™s war.

item.title: Wildfires: How are they linked to climate change?
item.description: A series of major wildfires across the world has hit the headlines - how do they compare to previous years?

item.title: Wildfires: How Portuguese club Tondela drove through the flames
item.description: In Tondela, the bond between club and fans was at its strongest during the night in October 2017 when nobody slept.

item.title: How we can all get more high-quality sleep
item.description: The pandemic has led to a sharp increase in insomnia, but some firms are now helping their staff.

item.title: Kathy Hochul: New York's next governor influenced by Irish roots
item.description: Kathy Hochul's grandparents were from Ireland and had a "profound impact" on her political outlook.

item.title: Five things we learned from UN climate report
item.description: What are the key takeaways from the IPCC new study on the science of climate change?

item.title: Greece fires: Hundreds rescued by coastguard
item.description: The coastguard moved 650 people from Limni, in the north of the island of Evia.

item.title: Lukashenko: 'You can choke on your sanctions in the UK'
item.description: The UK and US are tightening sanctions on Belarus, hitting economic sectors.

item.title: 'They call me the Irish hulk of basketball'
item.description: Aidan Igiehon is part of a group of elite Irish athletes playing college basketball in America.

item.title: Will Turkey's bees return after the wildfires?
item.description: Residents of Marmaris, Turkey, are mourning their bees and honey, lost to fires.

item.title: Tankus the Henge: Touring in France post-Brexit 'a puzzle'
item.description: Band Tankus the Henge negotiates touring in France, their first trip there since Brexit rules were imposed.
